title: Fetch Documentation
description: Learn to use WebFetch to retrieve documentation and get up-to-date information.

initialFiles.content:
# Challenge: Fetch Documentation

Use Claude's web tools to fetch documentation for a library.

## Objectives
1. Ask Claude to look up the React useState hook documentation
2. Create a summary of what you learned in notes.md
3. Create a simple example component using useState

hints.text: Ask Claude to look up and explain React's useState hook, then create examples based on what it finds.
Try: 'Look up React useState documentation, summarize it in notes.md, and create a Counter component example'
Ask: 'Fetch the React useState documentation, then: 1) Create notes.md explaining how useState works, 2) Create Counter.jsx showing a working example with increment/decrement buttons'

solution.approach: Ask Claude to fetch documentation and create summary and examples.
solution.example: Look up useState docs, create notes and example component
alternativeApproaches: Ask for specific aspects of the documentation
Request multiple examples showing different use cases

learningPoints: Claude can fetch and summarize documentation
Web research provides current, accurate information
Always verify information with official sources
